title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When using the Java editor, the process of reverting a file is significantly slower compared to closing and reopening the file.
EB: This seems odd, as reverting the file contents should not take more time than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a Java file in the editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Use the 'Revert' option to discard the changes.
4. Measure the time taken for the reverting process.
5. Close the file and reopen it.
6. Measure the time taken for this process.
7. Compare the time taken for reverting and closing/reopening the file.
